metadata.Title: CVE-2021-20266 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in RPM's hdrblobInit() in lib/header.c. This flaw allows an attacker who can modify the rpmdb to cause an out-of-bounds read. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20266` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

librpm9 - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
librpmbuild9 - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
librpmio9 - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
librpmsign9 - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
python3-rpm - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
rpm - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
rpm-common - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
rpm-i18n - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
rpm2cpio - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> Only debugedit and librpmio9 binary packages are in main, and triaged with view to how they are used in the build process as described in https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/rpm/+bug/1913871

criterions.comment: rpm package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.17.0+dfsg1-1').
